item.title: Curriculum Vitae
item.description: Marie VAUGOYEAU Skills Field skills on birds and reptiles Lab skills Vertebrates’ manipulation Language Computer skills Experiences 2016-2017 1-year teaching assistant in biostatistics. Laboratory Mer, Molécules, Santé. EA 2160. Le Mans University 2014-2015 1-year teaching assistant in ecology and evolution. Laboratory Ecology, Systematic, Evolution, Paris-Sud University. 2011-2014 PhD student in ecology and evolution. Maternal effects as mediators of climate changes: mechanisms and consequences in avian populations. Evolutionary ecology department, iEES-Paris.

item.title: About Me
item.description: Ph.D. in Ecology and Evolution Since 2011, I work in ecology and especially I study influence of urbanised world on ecosystems. I am interesting by statistics and R-used. Contact: marie.vaugoyeau@gmail.com Twitter LinkedIn

item.title: My first article: A not fully crossed design
item.description: First Step: Check the repeatability of the data Second step: Linear mixed models with backward elimination Linear mixed model Distribution of model residuals Model selection with backward elimination Final model Random effect Third and last step: Analyse results In 2015, I published the article: Is oxidative status influenced by dietary carotenoid and physical activity after moult in the great tit (Parus major)? about my first experimentation. In the aim to investigate on the relationship between dietary carotenoids, physical activity and oxidative status, I captured great tits and kept them in aviaries.

item.title: First post
item.description: It is not easy to start, the first step is the hardest… I created this site to explain statistical analyses and used of R that I already did. It is also intended to evolve with my future works. See you.
